body.name: Camp Chef Mountain Series Everest 2X - High Output Two-Burner Camp Stove - Lid Doubles as Windscreen - Portable Cooking Stove - For Outdoor Cooking - 20,000 BTU Burners - 215 Sq In Cooking Area
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 5 hrs 29 mins
features: Powerful Two Burner Stove: Cook up breakfast on one side and heat a kettle of water on the other with two 10,000 BTU burners
Short Camp Stove with Folding Lid: Its compact design and folding lid make it easy to transport and store; perfect for any camping trip or outdoor excursion
Wind-Resistant Gas Stove: The included lid works as a wind screen for heat distribution and protection; helps you cook in every weather
Includes Camping Accessories: This durable propane camp stove includes an adaptor for 1 lb propane cylinder
About Us: Camp Chef is a passionate team committed to bringing five-star flavor with versatile gear that can stand up to the demands of the backcountry and back patio
body.description: Designed for avid outdoorsmen, the new sleek design of the Everest 2X Mountain Series system is both lightweight and portable. Packed with two, 20,000 BTU burners, the Everest offers quick, matchless ignition no matter your coordinates. Adventure seekers will enjoy a generous 215 sq. inches of cook space engineered for maximum food output. So get out there and conquer your Everest.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: New Camp Chef Everest 2x MSHPX Designed for avid outdoorsmen, the new sleek design of the Everest 2X Mountain Series system is both lightweight and portable. Packed with two, 20,000 BTU burners, the Everest offers quick, matchless ignition no matter your coordinates. Adventure seekers will enjoy a generous 215 sq. inches of cook space engineered for maximum food output. So get out there and conquer your Everest.

Two, 20K BTUs/Hr. burners combine for a total for 40K BTUs/Hr. Matchless ignition you can get your cooking system roaring with the twist of a knob. A complete redesign giving the 2x a much sturdier frame and easier ignition. Folding lid provides a 3-sided wind screen when in use and a convenient transportation option when not.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WOW!! Even better than hoped for
reviews.reviewText: I was hesitant to replace the sturdy but irregular propane two burner Coleman stove that was handed down to me and is at least 25 years old. I read the reviews on this and decided to give it a shot. I took it camping and was blown away - the igniter works fine for both burners; the heat output on high is phenomenal and it went down low enough for me to cook eggs. The quality seems excellent to me and it’s so super easy to clean. The two wind guards folding out from the sides are held in place securely by the same two clips that secure the lid for transport. The top will fold down completely if needed for larger pots/pans. It looks so nice that I’m hesitant to leave it out in view when I’m not in the campsite. I do hook it up to a 5 gallon propane tank because I know it will blow through the gas. I run it off of a multi connection propane tree mounted onto the 5 gallon tank. Im able run both my lantern and the stove going on full power. I do recommend getting a filter between a tank and the stove. My only regret is that I waited so long to buy this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Camp Stove
reviews.reviewText: I would say that this probably the best camp stove I have ever owned. It is very well made and much larger than I had expected, but that works well for my needs. I would not recommend it for someone who is backpacking as it is quite heavy. Camp Chef seems to be turning out some of the best products in their market segments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great temperature control.The high setting is like a jet engine!Crazy!I love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great camp stove

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Had the camp chef three burner Ranger. It was just too big and heavy. Also no built in wind screen. The explorer is no lite weight but has great power with wind screen. A good cooker. Wish it had a carrying handle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Product, Great Customer Service
reviews.reviewText: After years of use, my old Coleman camp stove finally reached the end of its useful life. The hose connection between the stove and propane tank had either been damaged or was simply worn out from usage and had sprung a leak.Replacement parts were no longer available.I was about to order a new Coleman stove but decided to check some online resources for reviews on camp stoves.In six different reviews, the Camp Chef Everest 2X rated #1 (4 out of 6), #2 (1 out of 6) or was in the top four (1 out of 6).I was particularly attracted by the products high BTU ratings.I decided to purchase the Everest 2X.Being late in the camping season when I received the unit, I did not immediately open the carton to inspect and try-out my new stove.However, before stowing the camping gear completely this year, I decided to check out the new stove.Sometimes, despite our best efforts, things just don’t work out as expected. The new stove was received with some manufacturing defects.These things happen.I contacted Camp Chef, and they replaced the stove with a completely new and different unit.Upon receipt of the replacement stove, I took it for a trial cook-out and it performs beyond expectations. The high BTU capability is great, and the materials and workmanship of the product is outstanding.When things go wrong with a product or service (and they will from time to time) how the issue is addressed is what differentiates manufacturers and service providers in their customer service level.I recommend the Everest 2X for those in the market for a camp stove. I also recommend Camp Chef as a company with outstanding customer service.Check out their full line of products on their website.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great, well made campstove
reviews.reviewText: We have used this a couple times. As has been noted, it could use levelers, but that's an easy workaround with anything handy to use as a shim. The controls are very precise. My previous, cheapy stoves were hard to adjust and just wouldn't turn down low--they'd either fade off or run too high. Not the case with this one. We were surprised that the fuel consumption was not as bad as we expected. We just use the green disposable cans (actually, we recycle them), instead of connecting to a refillable large propane tank. On a three day, two night trip, with five cooked meals, I think we only used up one can. (However, we heat water for coffee on a separate jet-boil system).I would say, on the downside, the stove is fairly bulky and heavy, and a little difficult to carry, but the positives far outweigh these negatives.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: performed as advertised works get quick working
Works like a charm. Boils fast and simmers gently. Sometimes had trouble with the surge valve on the cylinder so had to open the cylinder valve and burner valve slowly.

I ordered Dec. 02/2022 and it came by Amazon Dec. 09/2022 I paid CDN$ 276.11 with Amazon prime and taxes. It has gone up to way too much now. Everyone told me I paid way too much even though good quality. Now price gone up to $340 days after I ordered. So far so good, it works fine, and can go to a low simmer.
